name: Titanium.UI.ScrollableView
summary: A view that encapsulates a horizontally-scrolling set of child views, known as pages, navigable using its built-in horizontal swipe gestures.

methods.name: addView
methods.summary: Adds a new page to this Scrollable View.

methods.name: insertViewsAt
methods.summary: Inserts views at the specified position in the views array.

parameters.name: position
parameters.summary: Position(index) in the views array to insert the view

methods.name: moveNext
methods.summary: Sets the current page to the next consecutive page in views.
methods.description: Since Titanium Mobile Release 3.3.0, using this method to change current page animates the change on iOS and Android.

methods.name: movePrevious
methods.summary: Sets the current page to the previous consecutive page in views.
methods.description: Since Titanium Mobile Release 3.3.0, using this method to change current page animates the change on iOS and Android.

methods.name: removeView
methods.summary: Removes an existing page from this Scrollable View.
methods.description:
On Android, does nothing if the page does not exist in views.

On iOS, throws an exception if the page does not exist in views or the index is invalid.

parameters.name: view
parameters.summary: A Titanium.UI.View object (all platforms) or integer index (Android and iOS only) of the page to remove.

parameters.name: view
parameters.summary: An integer index or Titanium.UI.View object to set as the current page.

methods.name: setIndicatorImageForPage
methods.summary: Sets the indicator image for the specified page.
methods.description: Override the indicator image for a specific page. Symbol images are recommended. Use systemImage to get system-supplied symbol images. See examples section for usage.

parameters.name: image
parameters.summary: The image for the indicator, defined using a local filesystem path, or a Blob object containing image data. Resets to the default if image is null.

properties.name: cacheSize
properties.summary: Number of pages to cache (pre-render).
properties.description: Pages are rendered in the range (currentPage +/- (cacheSize - 1)/2), rounded down for even values (i.e. cacheSize=4 renders 3 pages into the cache.) Keep in mind that improved performance (larger cache) will lead to faster performance, but greater memory usage.

properties.name: clipViews
properties.summary: Determines whether the previous and next pages are clipped, so that they are not visible adjacent to the current page.
properties.description: Set to false to allow the previous or next pages to be seen. Note that ScrollableView's width must be smaller than its parent view in order to make this property effective.

properties.name: currentPage
properties.summary: Index of the active page.
properties.description: Since Titanium Mobile Release 3.3.0, using this property to change current page changes the page without animation on iOS and Android.

properties.name: currentPageIndicatorColor
properties.summary: Color for the current page of the paging control, as a color name or hex triplet.
properties.description: For information about color values, see the "Colors" section of Titanium.UI.

properties.name: disableBounce
properties.summary: Determines whether page bouncing effect is disabled.

properties.name: hitRect
properties.summary: Sets the region where this view responds to gestures.
properties.description:
This property is particularly useful when clipViews is set to false and the dimension of this view is small, to create a larger area for the user to perform swipe gestures against.

Note that the x and y values specified are relative to the position of the view.

properties.name: overlayEnabled
properties.summary: Determines whether the paging control is added as an overlay to the view.
properties.description: If this property is set to true, the view takes up the entire height available in the parent view and the paging control is placed over the view. It is advisable to set an appropriate value for pagingControlAlpha along with this property, so that the underlying view content may be seen properly.

properties.name: overScrollMode
properties.summary: Determines the behavior when the user overscolls the view.

properties.name: padding
properties.summary: The padding applied to the scrollable view.

properties.name: pageIndicatorColor
properties.summary: Color of the paging control, as a color name or hex triplet.
properties.description: For information about color values, see the "Colors" section of Titanium.UI.

properties.name: pagingControlAlpha
properties.summary: Alpha value of the paging control.

properties.name: pagingControlColor
properties.summary: Color of the paging control, as a color name or hex triplet.
properties.description: For information about color values, see the "Colors" section of Titanium.UI.

properties.name: pagingControlHeight
properties.summary: Height of the paging control, in pixels.

properties.name: pagingControlOnTop
properties.summary: Determines whether the paging control is displayed at the top or bottom of the view.
properties.description: Set to true for the paging control at the top.

properties.name: pagingControlTimeout
properties.summary: Number of milliseconds to wait before hiding the paging control.
properties.description: Set to less than or equal to 0 to disable timeout, to keep controls displayed.

properties.name: preferredIndicatorImage
properties.summary: The preferred image for indicators, defined using a local filesystem path, or a Blob object containing image data.
properties.description: Symbol images are recommended. Use systemImage to get system-supplied symbol images. See examples section for usage.

properties.name: scrollingEnabled
properties.summary: Determines whether scrolling is enabled for the view.
properties.description: If this property is unset or true, scrolling is enabled.

properties.name: showPagingControl
properties.summary: Determines whether the paging control is visible.

properties.name: views
properties.summary: Sets the pages within this Scrollable View.
